page.title: 14The River Dee
page.content: Glenlochar and Crossmichael lie in the Dee valley. This fast flowing river is harnessed for hydro-electric power upstream at Tongland, Glenlee, Carsfad and now at Drumjohn. At Glenlochar there is a barrage or dam consisting of 6 steel lifting gates. The barrage attendant Mr McCreadie records the rainfall, temperature and wind direction every morning and sends the information to Ayr for weather forecasting and recording. Further downstream at Boatcroft is a sewerage screen which measures how much sewerage goes down the Dee each year. This information is for the Galloway Water Board. In the Dee there is a variety of fish, pike, perch, roach, trout and salmon.
